data.title: PACK 3 Flavours Ideal for Portuguese Cheeses - Portuguese Flavours
data.meta_description: Create a board for Portuguese Cheeses with the best Portuguese jams in a tube. Serra da Star cheese with pumpkin and almond compote. Gourmet experience.
data.text:
Bravo de Esmolfe Apple Extra Jam with Cinnamon

Bravo de Esmolfe apple (55%), sugar, cinnamon (3.5%), gelling agent (pectin) and lemon juice. Prepared with 55 g of fruits per 100 g. Net weight: 75 g.

Fig and Orange Extra Jam with Port Wine

Fig (45%), sugar, orange (10%), Port wine (1.5%) (contains sulfites), gelling agent (pectin) and lemon juice. Allergens: contains sulfites. Prepared with 55 g of fruits per 100 g. Net weight: 75 g. Contains alcohol

Pumpkin and Orange Jam with Rosemary and Eucalyptus Honey, Cinnamon and Almond

Pumpkin (35%), sugar, orange (20%), eucalyptus honey (3.2%), almond (3%), cinnamon (1.6%), rosemary honey (1.5%), gelling agent (pectin) and lemon juice. Prepared with 55 g of fruits per 100 g. Net weight: 75 g. Allergens: Contains almond.

Bravo de Esmolfe Apple Extra Jam with Cinnamon

Average nutritional information per 100 g / 3.53 oz: Energy 673 kJ / 161 kcal ; Fats 0.4 g / 0.0 oz , of which saturated fat acids 0.1 g / 0.0 oz ; Carbohydrates 40.0 g / 1.4 oz , of which sugars 39.3 g / 1.4 oz ; Proteins 0.3 g / 0.0 oz ; Salt 0.0 g / 0.0 oz.

Fig and Orange Extra Jam with Port Wine

Average nutritional information per 100 g / 3.53 oz: Energy 768 kJ / 184 kcal; Fats 0.3g / 0.0 oz, of which saturated fat acids 0.1g / 0.0 oz; Carbohydrates 45.2g / 1.6 oz, of which sugars 44.4g / 1.6 oz; Proteins 0.6g / 0.0 oz; Salt 0.0g / 0.0 oz.

Pumpkin and Orange Jam with Rosemary and Eucalyptus Honey, Cinnamon and Almond

Average nutritional information per 100 g / 3.53 oz: Energy 840 kJ / 201 kcal; Fats 2.0 g / 0.1 oz , of which saturated fat acids 0.2 g / 0.0 oz ; Carbohydrates 45.4 g / 1.6 oz , of which sugars 44.7 g / 1 .6 oz ; Proteins 1.1 g / 0.0 oz ; Salt 0.0 g / 0.0 oz.

The Bravo de Esmolfe ApplePDO is an apple with unique characteristics, extremely aromatic and juicy, sweet and at the same time acidic. It has an oblong-conical shape, white pulp and its whitish epidermis sometimes has pink spots. This regional variety, known since the 19th century XVIII, is originally from the village of Esmolfe (Penalva do Castelo, Portugal) and would have come from a tree first cultivated from a seed. As its fruits are very popular, grafts were obtained that spread this variety to several fruit production areas, especially in the Beira Alta Region and in part of Cova da Beira.

Depending on the season of production, figs are called lampos (May and June) and vintage (July/September). It is a fruit with well-marked organoleptic characteristics, with great nutritional qualities, being rich in vitamins B and C and mineral salts (especially calcium, phosphorus and potassium). Thin, colorful and shiny skin, high juice content, sweetness and unique organoleptic characteristics are some of the characteristics of orange from the Algarve.

Rosemary and eucalyptus honey, more aromatic than other honeys, has a light brown tone and a more open aroma and palate.

Originating in North and Central America, where it is still one of the mainstays of food, the pumpkin belongs to the same family as the melon and watermelon (cucurbits). The shape of the pumpkin is variable, but it is usually ovoid or oblong. The rind is usually orange, but it can have other colors depending on the species. The bright orange color of the pumpkin contains a high content of carotenes, particularly beta-carotene, with antioxidant action. Beta carotene is then converted into vitamin A in the body.

Almonds - Trás-os-Montes Region, Portugal.
